title: Undersea Volcano Station Adventure #22
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Main Control Room
rooms.description: A cramped control room with flickering monitors displaying seismic warnings. Red emergency lights pulse across banks of equipment. Through the reinforced viewport, you see the dark ocean depths and the ominous glow of volcanic vents below. The station groans under pressure as tremors shake the walls. Warning klaxons echo through the corridors.

items.name: main control console
items.description: The primary station control panel covered in blinking warning lights and status displays
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: CRITICAL. Volcanic activity at dangerous levels. Station Commander: Dr. Elena Vasquez. Chief Engineer: Marcus Webb. Established: 2089. All personnel evacuate to escape pod bay immediately.

items.name: emergency equipment locker
items.description: A red locker marked with emergency symbols and multiple compartments

items.name: station operations manual
items.description: A waterproof manual with emergency procedures
items.text: UNDERSEA VOLCANO RESEARCH STATION - Established 2089. In case of volcanic emergency, proceed to escape pod bay. Access requires security clearance. Bottom compartment code is station founding year: 2089.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'RESEARCH LAB ACCESS'

items.name: seismic monitoring station
items.description: A display showing real-time volcanic activity readings
items.text: SEISMIC ALERT: Magma chamber pressure critical. Eruption imminent. Dr. Vasquez has authorized emergency evacuation. All research data stored in research lab. Chief Engineer Webb maintains escape systems.

items.name: station commander's desk
items.description: A metal desk bolted to the floor with scattered papers and equipment

items.name: commander's log
items.description: A digital tablet with the commander's personal notes
items.text: Commander's Log - Dr. Elena Vasquez: The volcanic activity is worse than predicted. I've ordered evacuation to the escape pod bay. Marcus is ensuring the pods are operational. Research data in the lab documents our findings. We must survive to share what we've learned.

items.name: supply cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet containing emergency supplies

items.name: emergency flashlight
items.description: A waterproof flashlight for emergency situations

items.name: research lab door
items.description: A reinforced pressure door with a card reader, leading to the research laboratory

rooms.name: Research Laboratory
rooms.description: A state-of-the-art laboratory filled with scientific equipment and specimen tanks. Bioluminescent samples from volcanic vents glow eerily in containment units. Research stations line the walls, and a large viewport shows the churning volcanic activity below. The floor vibrates with each tremor. Emergency lighting casts everything in an amber glow.

items.name: research station alpha
items.description: A workstation covered with geological samples and analysis equipment

items.name: research journal
items.description: Dr. Vasquez's research documentation
items.text: Research Notes: Our study of the undersea volcano has yielded incredible discoveries. The unique ecosystem thrives in the thermal vents. However, the magma chamber is unstable. Chief Engineer Webb has prepared the escape pod bay as a precaution. Location: escape pod bay is north of the research lab.

items.name: bioluminescent specimen tanks
items.description: Glass tanks containing glowing organisms from the volcanic vents
items.text: Specimen labels: Thermophilic bacteria, tube worms, and bioluminescent fish collected from volcanic vents. These organisms survive in extreme heat and pressure. Research conducted by Dr. Elena Vasquez and team.

items.name: research filing cabinet
items.description: A waterproof cabinet with personnel files and research data

items.name: personnel records
items.description: Files on station crew members
items.text: STATION PERSONNEL: Dr. Elena Vasquez - Station Commander, Volcanologist. Marcus Webb - Chief Engineer, Escape Systems. Dr. Sarah Kim - Marine Biologist. Tech Officer Rodriguez - Systems Maintenance. Commander Vasquez has final authority on all evacuations.

items.name: mission summary report
items.description: A comprehensive report on the station's mission
items.text: MISSION SUMMARY: Undersea Volcano Research Station established to study geothermal activity and extremophile ecosystems. Primary location: escape pod bay provides emergency evacuation capability. Station Commander Dr. Vasquez leads all operations. Critical systems maintained by Chief Engineer Webb.

items.name: equipment table
items.description: A table with various scientific instruments and tools

items.name: emergency safety protocol
items.description: A laminated card with evacuation procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In case of volcanic eruption, proceed immediately to escape pod bay. Security verification required. You must confirm: Who commands this station? Where are the escape pods located? Who maintains escape systems?

items.name: reinforced viewport
items.description: A thick glass window showing the volcanic activity outside
items.text: Through the viewport, you see glowing lava flows and superheated water. The volcanic eruption is imminent. The escape pod bay is your only hope for survival.

items.name: escape pod bay door
items.description: A heavy blast door leading to the escape pod bay. A security terminal displays three verification questions that must be answered correctly.

password_questions.question: Who commands this station?
password_questions.hint: Check the main console, personnel records, and research notes

password_questions.question: Where are the escape pods located?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention the location of emergency evacuation

password_questions.question: Who maintains the escape systems?
password_questions.hint: Look at personnel files and the commander's log

rooms.name: Escape Pod Bay
rooms.description: You've reached the escape pod bay! A sleek emergency evacuation pod sits in its launch cradle, its systems humming with power. Status lights glow green across the control panel. Through the launch tube, you can see the dark ocean above, your path to safety. The station shudders violently as the volcano erupts below, but you're ready to escape.

items.name: emergency escape pod
items.description: A pressurized evacuation vehicle designed to reach the surface quickly

items.name: pod launch controls
items.description: The control panel showing all systems ready for immediate launch
items.text: ESCAPE POD STATUS: All systems operational. Pressure seals intact. Life support active. Coordinates set for surface rendezvous. Ready for immediate launch.

items.name: emergency supply locker
items.description: A locker stocked with survival gear for the journey to the surface

items.name: survival kit
items.description: Emergency supplies including food, water, and medical equipment

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You board the escape pod and initiate the launch sequence. The pod rockets upward through the launch tube as the volcano erupts below, destroying the research station. Within minutes, you breach the surface and see rescue ships approaching. You've survived the undersea volcano disaster and escaped with your life. The research data you gathered will help future missions. You win!
